intro: Gochnatia cardenasii, commonly known as the Mexican gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its small, yellowish to brownish flowers. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its structure is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Gochnatia cardenasii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
